citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau
U.S. Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), National Geodetic Survey (NGS)
citeinfo.title: United States States, 2022

descript.abstract: U.S. States represents the 50 states and the District of Columbia of the United States. U.S. States are polygons containing population totals from the 2020 Census.
descript.purpose: U.S. States provides the boundaries, and 2020 U.S. Census codes and population information for the U.S. states. The boundaries are consistent with the county, and Census block group and tract datasets, and are effective at regional and state levels.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States- Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, contact Esri by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing +1-888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at +1-909-792-0960; or visit https://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States- Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by email, telephone, or fax or write to us.

dataqual.logic: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The spatial accuracy varies with the source materials used. The Census Bureau cannot specify the spatial accuracy of features changed or added by field staff or through local updates, features derived from the GBF/DIME Files (TIGER's predecessor in 1970 and 1980), or other map or digital sources. The positional accuracy is unknown.

serinfo.sername: Census Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File

citeinfo.othercit: The initial source of this data is the 2020 Census Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), National Geodetic Survey (NGS)
citeinfo.title: NOAA National Shoreline

pubinfo.publish: National Ocean Service (NOS), National Geodetic Survey (NGS)

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Downloaded Census TIGER/Line Geodatabases 2020 from the U.S. Census Bureau and extracted the states dataset. Clipped to the shoreline using Census TIGER/Line Hydrography Geodatabases 2020 and NOAA National Shoreline datasets. Projected the dataset to World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS84). Added the fields STATE_ABBR, STATE_FIPS, and STATE_NAME and copied their values from the values of their source fields. Added the field POPULATION (alias POPULATION_2020) from Esri and U.S. Census Bureau: 2020 (Public Law 94-171). Added the field SQMI and calculated its values projected to North America Albers Equal Area Conic. Added and calculated the field POP_SQMI (alias POP20_SQMI). Reordered and removed fields.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the states within the United States. States and Equivalent Entities are the primary governmental divisions of the United States. In addition to the 50 states, the U.S. Census Bureau treats the District of Columbia as the statistical equivalent of a state for the purpose of data presentation.
enttyp.enttypds: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau
